data.text:
John Edward Cantwell OBITUARY

John Edward Cantwell July 11, 1920 – August 25, 2004 John E. Cantwell passed away at the age of 84. Born in Detroit, Michigan, he lived in Oakland before moving to Walnut Creek, where he lived for 50 years. John was a WWII veteran. He served with the 104th Infantry Division (The Timberwolves) in Europe. His regiment received the presidential unit citation. His division served the most consecutive days of battle (156) in the military history of the United States. He was also awarded a Bronze Star and Purple Heart. John attended Loyola University and worked as a labor law attorney in Oakland for 40 years. He retired two years ago. He was associated with the University of San Francisco School of Law. During his life, he enjoyed backpacking throughout the Sierra Nevadas, where he spent summers hiking with his family. John is survived by daughter Jeanne Cantwell of Concord; sons John Cantwell, Jr., Lawrence Cantwell and James Cantwell, all of Concord; and two grandchildren. Funeral services will be held Tues., August 31, 2004 at 11 a.m., St. John Vianney Catholic Church, 1650 Ygnacio Valley Road, Walnut Creek. Hull’s Walnut Creek Chapel 925-934-5400
